alert.note: Alert for West Central Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 3:41PM MDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Valley County through 415 PM MDT... At 341 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Deer Creek Pass, or 19 miles north of Lowman, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Deer Creek Pass around 400 PM MDT. Deadwood Summit and Bear Valley Campground around 410 PM MDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for southwestern Idaho.
